lines.text: There's your dog; your dog's dead. But where's the thing that made it move? It had to be something, didn't it?
When I turn my back I don't know you, not truly, but I can turn my back on my little dog and I know that he's not going to jump on me or bite me. But human begings can't be that way.
Death is for the living and not for the dead.
Surely at the gates of heaven an all-compassionate God is not going to say, "Well, you're walking in on two legs, you can go in. You're walking in four legs, we can't take you."
